metadata.description: Comprehensive trades ledger - all trades with compliance, statistics, and analysis

trades.thesis: Short continuation from morning weakness with QQQ under resistance
rule_violations: Entered without trigger confluence (skipped monthly/weekly/daily mids)
Skipped AVWAP and gamma flip checks
VIX re-entry ON - should not trade naked breakdowns
lessons_learned: Direction filter: QQQ must be <600.9
Only short on rejection or break-retest, not inside range
Volume confirmation required: ≥1.3× 20-bar average
VIX re-entry ON means only trade breaks with retests
Pre-set stops critical: 190.5 on rejection shorts
trades.notes: Flat day trade. Respected exit plan but entered without system confirmation. This trade triggered corrective rules.

trades.thesis: Fade 663-665 SPY resistance with target toward 657-654
rule_violations: 5-min 200 EMA was flat (should be falling for shorts)
ADD improving (+50) - should not fade improving breadth
Trading counter-trend without confirmation (above 20 EMA daily)
lessons_learned: Require C+R confirmation before fading
Only short when 5-min 200 EMA is FALLING
Don't fade improving internals (ADD)
Counter-trend trades must be half-size minimum
Created Rule #7: SPY/SPXU short requires full trigger stack
trades.notes: Quick stop. Correct resistance call but no structural confirmation. 5-min EMA shifted from down→flat→up. Excellent early exit prevented larger loss.

trades.thesis: Followed Andy's puts read via SPXU. SPY max-pain coil trade.
lessons_learned: Max-pain coil strategy effective when structure allows
Use inverse ETF for tactical hedges/contrarian plays
Exit as price gravitates back to max-pain area - don't chase
AVWAP and VWAP confluence = clean risk management
trades.notes: Round-trip trade following Andy's expertise. Solid execution. Exited as SPY reclaimed 9-SMA and moved toward max-pain. Perfect discipline on profit-taking.

trades.thesis: Tactical intraday long; details TBD in original notes
lessons_learned: SOLZ (Solana tracking) responsive to crypto momentum
Same-session management effective for intraday swings
Daytrading discipline worked - didn't hold overnight
trades.notes: Good day after market repair. Choppy ES morning (6650-6700 range), psychology remained constructive. Post-dump coiling setup.

trades.thesis: 9-day EMA mean reversion - Chris Lori recommendation
lessons_learned: External advice from credible source still requires OUR verification
Conviction in advisor ≠ conviction in setup
Respect the process (threat assessment + rule check) more than advisor credibility
Created Rule #17: Never enter on external tip without verifying against trigger checklist
trades.notes: Heard Chris say 'market should come back to 9-day EMA'. Believed in mean reversion. Entered without running threat assessment. Small loss but clear rule violation. Pattern: Over-eagerness in uncertain structure.

patterns: Skipping checklist when conviction in idea is high (Oct 27)
Good discipline on exits when structure is clear (Oct 15, Oct 17)

rules_created.rule: SPY/SPXU short trigger requires: C+R confirmation, EMA filter falling, volume 1.3×, ADD confirming, signal tier ≥ MODERATE
Never enter on external tip without verifying against trigger checklist. External advice ≠ OUR thesis.

next_session_priorities: Build range-fade edge (0% currently - avoid until confluence improves)
Refine inverse ETF/hedge trades (100% win rate - continue this setup)
Improve external advice evaluation (verify before entry, not after)
Track daily average PnL: $29/day baseline, target $83/day for $2.5k monthly
